Articles.Content: Are there any mods that add more space station parts? I used to use FusTek station parts but sumghai has halted development. Is there any other mods that add a ton of station parts like his?

The Orbital Kolonization System (OKS), by Roverdude, does, doesn't it? I've enjoyed it. But I'm also interested in learning whether there are other alternatives.

Also, I have a related question. I'm wondering which mod or combination of mods makes space stations *matter* the most. OKS? Station Science?

@Catsceo check this one out: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/91814

@Mister Spock Station science makes them a useful tool for science. Building some LKO science stations will massively help your science progression in career. That said, I don't believe they give you too much extra science for doing it in other SOIs so if you want a challenge and meaning there, go with OKS.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/91814-0-25-Stockalike-Station-Parts-Expansion-%2817-11-2014-CTT-compatibility%29

Definitely one of my favourites, looks great and the parts are really versatile to boot.

Edit: Heh, beaten to it.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/91814-0-25-Stockalike-Station-Parts-Expansion-%2817-11-2014-CTT-compatibility%29

Definitely one of my favourites, looks great and the parts are really versatile to boot.

Edit: Heh, beaten to it.

XD Even LLL has some good stuff for stations, albeit it makes far better land bases.

And if it's a Nertea mod, I'll be on it faster than you can push to orbit.

XD Even LLL has some good stuff for stations, albeit it makes far better land bases.

And if it's a Nertea mod, I'll be on it faster than you can push to orbit.

Yeah, the very first LLL parts I made were for a space station, then I started building a base on the mun, so it ended up being a little bit more base orientated. Still made some space stations I'm fond of with it though.
